content.raw: Works for me!
content.html: Works for me!

content.raw: Just curious, why use `Eigen` types instead of `ign-math` types?
content.html: Just curious, why use Eigen types instead of ign-math types?

content.raw: The main reason for using Eigen is that we need dynamic sized matrices. LU factorization from Eigen is also used to determine if the vehicle is controllable.
content.html: The main reason for using Eigen is that we need dynamic sized matrices. LU factorization from Eigen is also used to determine if the vehicle is controllable.

content.raw: I just added the ability to set maximum linear and angular commanded velocities in c1ded2a. I'd appreciate another look @{557058:65740f22-cc56-4418-9608-7e17d0ed47b7} , @{557058:14b7fd50-d65a-47a8-825c-fa89681d07bd}
content.html: I just added the ability to set maximum linear and angular commanded velocities in c1ded2a. I'd appreciate another look @Michael Carroll , @Arthur Schang

content.raw: Appears to be reasonable.  500m/s 300rad/s commands looked the same as 5m/s and 3rad/s commands.  The X4 follows rotation commands much better than the X3.
content.html: Appears to be reasonable. 500m/s 300rad/s commands looked the same as 5m/s and 3rad/s commands. The X4 follows rotation commands much better than the X3.

content.raw: I believe most (all?) other plugins are using `camel_cased` parameters. Would it be too much trouble to change these now?
content.html: I believe most (all?) other plugins are using camel_cased parameters. Would it be too much trouble to change these now?

content.raw: It wouldn't be too much trouble, but I went with this because this will be used with the MulticopterModel system which uses `camelCase` parameters. I can go ahead and change it if you say the word.
content.html: It wouldn't be too much trouble, but I went with this because this will be used with the MulticopterModel system which uses camelCase parameters. I can go ahead and change it if you say the word.

content.raw: I don't want to add friction, let's leave this as is :wink: Just something to keep in mind for the future
content.html: I don't want to add friction, let's leave this as is Just something to keep in mind for the future
